field.name: id
field.comment: Contribution Recur ID

field.name: domain_id
field.comment: Which Domain owns this contribution class.

field.name: contact_id
field.comment: Foreign key to civicrm_contact.id .

field.name: amount
field.comment: Amount to be contributed or charged each recurrence.

field.name: frequency_unit
field.comment: Time units for recurrence of payment.

field.name: frequency_interval
field.comment: Number of time units for recurrence of payment.

field.name: installments
field.comment: Total number of payments to be made. Set this to 0 if this is an open-ended commitment i.e. no set end date.

field.name: start_date
field.comment: The date the first scheduled recurring contribution occurs.

field.name: create_date
field.comment: When this recurring contribution record was created.

field.name: modified_date
field.comment: Last updated date for this record. mostly the last time a payment was received

field.name: cancel_date
field.comment: Date this recurring contribution was cancelled by contributor- if we can get access to it

field.name: end_date
field.comment: Date this recurring contribution finished successfully

field.name: processor_id
field.comment: Possibly needed to store a unique identifier for this recurring payment order - if this is available from the processor??

field.name: trxn_id
field.title: Transaction ID
field.comment: unique transaction id. may be processor id, bank id + trans id, or account number + check number... depending on payment_method

field.name: invoice_id
field.title: Invoice ID
field.comment: unique invoice id, system generated or passed in

field.name: cycle_day
field.comment: Day in the period when the payment should be charged e.g. 1st of month, 15th etc.

field.name: next_sched_contribution
field.comment: At Groundspring this was used by the cron job which triggered payments. If we\'re not doing that but we know about payments, it might still be useful to store for display to org andor contributors.

field.name: failure_count
field.comment: Number of failed charge attempts since last success. Business rule could be set to deactivate on more than x failures.

field.name: failure_retry_date
field.comment: At Groundspring we set a business rule to retry failed payments every 7 days - and stored the next scheduled attempt date there.

field.name: auto_renew
field.comment: Some systems allow contributor to set a number of installments - but then auto-renew the subscription or commitment if they do not cancel.
